Setting reminders for recurring events can be a great way to ensure you don't forget about them. Recurring events, like your yoga class or team lunch meeting, can easily fall into the "out of sight, out of mind" category, especially if they happen at the same time every week.

Setting reminders for these events can help you stay on track and avoid last-minute scrambles. You can set reminders for:

* The day before the event to prepare or plan ahead
* A few hours before the event to get ready or leave on time
* At the exact time of the event to make sure you don't forget

You can also customize your reminders to fit your needs. For example, you might set a reminder to:

* "Pack your yoga mat and water bottle" the night before your yoga class
* "Review the meeting agenda" an hour before your team lunch meeting
* "Leave for the meeting location" 30 minutes before the meeting starts

Remember to set reminders that work for you and your schedule. You can also experiment with different reminder frequencies and formats (e.g., email, push notifications, or pop-ups) to find what works best for your brain.

In addition to setting reminders, you might consider implementing a " routine check-in" habit, where you regularly review your schedule for the day or week. This can help you stay on top of your appointments and events, even if you forget to check your calendar.

How does that sound? Are there any specific reminder strategies or tools you're interested in exploring?
